faq.question: What does 16X AVIF upscaling mean?
faq.answer: 16X upscaling multiplies both the width and height of your AVIF by 16, resulting in 256 times more total pixels.

faq.question: When should I use 16X for AVIF images?
faq.answer: 16X AVIF upscaling is only for highly specialized applications requiring extreme resolution. Use only when absolutely necessary.

faq.answer: Use 2X for moderate enhancement of GIF graphics, logos, and simple images when you need better resolution.

faq.question: Should I convert GIF to PNG after 2X upscaling?
faq.answer: Yes! Converting to PNG after 2X upscaling typically provides better quality and more colors for graphics.

faq.question: Is GIF good for photos at 2X?
faq.answer: No. GIF is limited to 256 colors, making it unsuitable for photos. Use JPEG or PNG for photographic content.
